page.title: 02Farming in the Wishford area
page.content: Mixed farming takes place in the area on four main farms,Manor Farm, the Drucella Farming Company,Hungerford Lodge,and Wilton Estate. The land between Stapleford and East Clyffe is occupied largely by Manor Farm and the crops are winter wheat, peas,and grass for hay,silage,grazing, and seed. East and South of Stapleford the Drucella Farming Co.grow wheat,sugar beet,and lupins.Land close to the rivers comprises water meadows and there are 2500 breeding sheep. Between Little Langford and the River Wylye,Hungerford Lodge runs a dairy herd and cereals and grass for silage are grown.South of the railway line,Wilton Estate grow cereals while Ebsbury Copse is bounded by pasture.
